intro: Dichocarpum numajirianum, commonly known as the Tibetan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of China, Nepal, and India. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, colorful flowers that range from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive lobed or divided shape. Dichocarpum numajirianum is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations.
